p: One of the most epidemiologically and evolutionarily important characteristics of HIV-1 group M (HIV 1M) is its extremely rapid rate of evolution. The explosive diversification of HIV-1M over the past century since it first started infecting humans has been primarily fuelled by the ∼0.3 mutation events ( Rambaut et al. 2004) and ∼5 recombination events ( Jetzt et al. 2000; Rhodes, Wargo, and Hu 2003) that occur during every viral replication cycle.
